ingredients.item: 25g pack fresh parsley, stalks and leaves finely chopped separately
150g raw king prawns, sliced in half

instructions.step: Rinse the clams in cold running water and scrub if necessary, then put them into a large bowl and cover with cold water. Salt generously and leave for a couple of hours, then drain and rinse well to remove any grit or sand.
Cook the spaghetti according to pack instructions. Meanwhile, heat a large saut√© pan and add the olive oil and half of the butter.
Fry the garlic, chilli and parsley stalks, add the prawns followed by the clams, give them a good stir then tip over the white wine.
When the clam shells are open (discard any clams that remain closed) and the prawns are pink, stir in the drained pasta. Finish with the lemon juice and zest, remaining butter and chopped parsley.
Let the pasta sit for a few minutes in the sauce to absorb all the flavours. Serve in pasta bowls with a wedge of lemon to squeeze over.
